intro: Polycodium candicans, commonly known as the shining polycodium, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in dense spikes. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Polycodium candicans is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
